fields.description:
Although it's always worked for me before, my current search in the issue navigator doesn't seem to be getting updated; perhaps a new bug introduced in a recent version?  We upgraded to 3.3 only recently, and we're using a patch for the Firefox layout issue.

--

In essence, I started a search on the current version of a project and then started moving issues out to later versions.  When I 'Return to Search' now, it shows 7 issues on the listing.  When I click through to any one issue, the 'Return to Search' box still shows 'Issue 5 of 11', when it should be 'Issue 1 of 7', or something of that ilk.

I may quickly gimp-conceal some of the local specifics and attach screenshots.
fields.summary: 'Return to Search' Issue Count is Incorrect

fields.description:
Currently when a field is calculated from sources other than the issue itself, Jira does not reindex the issue when the underlying values have changed. This leads to wrong search results.

In some cases, like the "last commenter" example in the docs, searching will work because a comment triggers a reindex of the issue, but most other calculated fields will also reference data that is held outside of the issue itself.

One example use cases is calculating an implicit due date from the due dates of the fix versions of that issue (see http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=8404&tstart=0). Currently when someone changes the version due date, the index would get out of sync.

There are many more use cases where searching calculated fields would be desirable and doesn't currently work:
- remote custom field like the Amazon search plugin from the tutorial
- fields that aggregate information from other issues (e.g. via following links)

Somehow a calculated field should be able to indicate which issues need a reindex before the field can be used as a search parameter, the default impl in CalculatedCFType would return an empty set.
fields.summary: Wrong search results for calculated fields
Cancelling from the "Create New Issue" page should return to your previous page rather than the dashboard

fields.description:
The "Days since last comment" field is nice, but its usefullness is limited by lack of following.

1. When added to a filter, you cannot sort by the field.  The field should be sortable.
2. You cannot create a filter based on the field.  It would be helpful to be create filters based on "Last Comment > x days" to help identify stalled issues.
fields.summary: Improve "Days since last comment " custom field

fields.description:
The left navigation column seems to be fixed width. The german headings no longer fit, see screenshot.

In previous releases the navigation column expanded so that all headings fit in.

Many languages tend to have longer words than the english language, so having fixed space for text that is to be translated should be avoided.
fields.summary: navigation column is too narrow

fields.description:
The time taken to delete a project is proportional to the number of issues it has. The number of comments, attachments, issue links, etc each issue has also affects the deletion time.

As an Issue Deleted event needs to be thrown for each issue, and each issue and its comments need to be removed from the lucene index, the deletetion has to be performed one issue at a time.

Need to investigate whether we can speed this up.
fields.summary: Improve speed of Delete Project operation

fields.description:
Help links on Issue Navigator seems to be broken under Orion

This is for internaol help links (e.g. for resolutions, issue types) don't have a context. This is probabably something server specific since it works fine in Tomcat.

It's possible that the line:

velocityParams.put("baseurl", ServletActionContext.getRequest().getContextPath());

does not work correctly under Orion.
fields.summary: Help links on Issue Navigator seems to be broken under Orion

fields.description:
I'm just wondering if I've set something up incorrectly. I re-opened an issue, and the resolution shows "Fixed", not "Unresolved". The change history shows I re-opened it from the Status "Verified" which is my intermediate step between Open/Re-opened and Closed in my workflow. I've attached my workflow as well. I notice the different ID's for Re-open issue. I also notice I have a different transition view screen, but I'm not sure what I've done wrong. All I know is that if I re-open a Verified issue, it doesn't reset to Unresolved. On my test system I tried creating a new workflow where the Transition for Reopen Issue also showed "Transition View: Assign Issue Screen". But it didn't seem to help. Would you be able to direct me to what I have done wrong?
Thanks

fields.description:
I have a user building graphs using the xml view of a filter pulling back > 1000 records from JIRA. 
In the previous version (3.0.3) we were running there was no limit to the number of records which could be pulled when referencing the xml view URL. 
With the new version (3.2.3) we are on there is a 'temp_max' variable which seems to limit the number of records returned by the query, and when this number is increased very much we get the following error:

 XML Parsing Error: not well-formed
Location: http://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=rss&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=1040&reset=true&decorator=none
Line Number 50723, Column 6:> High Precision Event Timer driver
-----^

Comment by Rufus Archon [19/Aug/05 10:36 AM]  Delete
[ Permlink ]
William, today this query failed without modifying the tempMax field.

Query and failure
XML Parsing Error: not well-formed
Location: http://jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=rss&pid=10003&statusIds=8&statusIds=12&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=25&reset=true&decorator=none
Line Number 1016, Column 6:> High Precision Event Timer driver
-----^
fields.summary: JIRA filter problem - 'High Performance filter timer error' when altering temp_max variable

fields.description: Sometimes users create a new issue that we would like to redefine as a sub task of one of the existing issues. We can link the issues with "is part of", which is great, but it would be realy nice if we could redefine the second issue as a sub-task of the parent issue.
fields.summary: Make existing issues sub-tasks

fields.description:
I noticed that when I paste text generated by an MS Office app into Jira, the server converts those custom characters into ? characters. This is a step forward from the old behavior but could still be improved. I get emails all the time from people that insist on using Word as their email editor for Outlook, and when I copy-paste them into bug comments they're filled with ?'s for all the single and double quotes, and often for "..." and dash characters.

Given how many people use MS Office with this auto-text feature, I think it's worth writing a little translator that converts incoming text in any field of a Jira form from using those goofy MS unicode characters into standard web-safe characters.
fields.summary: Add character substitutions for MS Office apps auto-text
Email To Feature

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7789].
  {panel}

The WSDL generate by Axis/JIRA gives parameters generic names like 'in0', 'in1' etc, which makes it difficult to tell what is what:

<wsdl:message name="addVersionRequest">
    <wsdl:part name="in0" type="xsd:string"/>
    <wsdl:part name="in1" type="xsd:string"/>
    <wsdl:part name="in2" type="tns1:RemoteVersion"/>
</wsdl:message>

The WSDL should report the actual method parameter names.
fields.summary: Use proper method parameter names in SOAP API's WSDL

fields.description: We updated to the latest version of the atlassian-plugins component. This changed the way we are grabbing licensing from the plugin so we need to still change the perforce plugin to work with this change.
fields.summary: Make sure that the perforce plugin license stuff will work with the new plugins module before 3.4

fields.description: Use-case: writing a script to list JIRA users, and then find those *not* in LDAP.
fields.summary: SOAP: add a getAllUsers() method

Attached are log files with more information.

fields.description:
Hi, JIRA Team!
I am a Korean. So I write Issue in Korean.
When I look RSS feed, it is truncated.
I found this problem only occurs When description or environment in Issue have Korean word.

But When I test this site with Korean, It works good!!!!

Maybe, I misconfigured something.

How can I solve this problem?
fields.summary: RSS / XML feeds with International Character are truncated.

see attachement : before open / after open
fields.summary: Find issues / ugly layout on Firefox when project's name is very long

in "Find issues" screen, url for local help (for example : the one on the side of "issue type") points to http://secure/ShowConstantsHelp.jspa?decorator=popup#IssueTypes.

Result : invalid link or display of "www.f-secure.com" home page..
fields.summary: Find issues / url for local help is wrong

fields.description:
Issues are often assigned to the wrong project, moved, etc. Developers would like to have each issue number (just the number of the key) be unique throughout the entire system.

Side Note: Entering the number 2 in the quick search only returns a single issue even though we have over 100 projects that have issue key numbers = 2 ... I'll create a new bug issue for this one.
fields.summary: System wide unique issue numbers
When adding watchers, the user-picker dialog should only show users who have access to the project.

fields.description: The manage watchers screen has the user picker icon and the word "list" in the wrong place. It's OK on Firefox.
fields.summary: minor rendering bug when adding watchers

fields.description:
In a text custom field you say you have a single value (say 1650) recorded in one issue and then that same value embedded in a comma delimited list of values:

1) Search for *1650* returns an error. This is because you don't allow a wildcard to be used as the first character.

2) Search for 1650* only returns the issue where 1650 is the only value, excludes the issue that has 1650 in a comma delimited list of other values ... e.g., "123, 1650, 567"

This makes it impossible to find all issues associated with a customer case id number to allow developers to link existing issues or find duplicates, etc.
fields.summary: Custom Field Search doesn't return proper results
Adding watchers should also search email addresses

fields.description: Considering the existing search interface does not allow you to query *every* area of data (e.g., worklog, change history, issue links, etc.) and some areas (custom fields) cannot be queried without knowing some preexisting details, it would be very handy to have a search module that allows users to specify their SQL Syntax of choice to be ran against the database.  A simple selectable field list that (on select) allows it to have its where clause value(s) specified for it.
fields.summary: Ability to create advanced queries to search across all data
Log information for services

fields.description:
Its not a big deal - but precision in seconds is probably more accurate than it needs to be...

(IIRC, it used to be minutes in J2.5.3)
fields.summary: Time fields (Original Estimate, Remaining Estimate, Time Spent) in excel are shown in seconds - seconds-precision is a little excessive.

fields.description: After I click, 'Force garbage collection', the uptime counter is reset. This doesn't seem right! Also, it seems that the session is destroyed, as I need to log back in just after I force garbage collection. If this is the proper behavior, it should be documented with perhaps some explanation as to the rationale.
fields.summary: Force garbage collection resets uptime.

fields.description: I ran a filter, and then edited the sort, so I got the "Filter modified since loading" message. Then I decided to "Reload original filter". When I clicked that link, it reloaded the original filter and its sort, and opened up the pane showing "View & Hide, View" buttons. But when I press View & Hide, the "Filter modified since loading" message re-appears even though it is in fact the original unmodified filter.
fields.summary: filter modified message appears when it hasn't been
Multiple reporters on one issue
Create sample / example / test data for users to use on local hosts

fields.description:
On the first setup page, we have a bunch of country flags on the right, denoting available languages. Under each flag, we have a description:

Danish (Denmark)
Norwegian (Norway)
German (Germany)
English (UK)

Listing the country seems rather pointless (most English people aren't in the UK, for instance).  Instead, we should print the language in that language, with the current language (by default, English) in brackets, eg:

日本語 (Japanese)
한국 (Korean)
Español (Spanish)
Français (French)
...

Apart from being more useful, this also gives unicode fans warm fuzzies.
fields.summary: Use native languages with setup page (under flags)
Move full content pagebreaks option ('jira.search.fullcontentview.pagebreaks') into General Configuration

fields.description: The Quick Search is a very powerful feature but typicaly users forget about syntax of the various queries they can do in this field.  It would be helpful if the Quick Search text next to the entry filed was a link a either a page or pop-up that provided a listing of everything that can be done with that field.
fields.summary: Quick Search Help Link
Performance Problems Adding Custom Field Options
Merge configuration

fields.description:
When Tomcat 5.5 (JIRA Standalone) comes up, it prints a message guaranteed to alarm those not familiar with JIRA logs:

SEVERE: No Store configured, persistence disabled
fields.summary: Disable Tomcat 5 session persistence

fields.description:
Modern browsers (firefox, opera, safari) and one day IE7 will auto-detect the existence of an RSS feed on HTML pages with the appropriate <link> tag:

<LINK REL="alternate" href="page.rss" TYPE="application/rss+xml">

We should add this tag to JIRA's issue navigator, so people can subscribe to search results in their browser.
fields.summary: Support browser auto-detection of RSS feed for issue navigator

fields.description:
When creating a user, if username or Full name is greater than 256 characters, very bad things happen.  Well, an error page is displayed...
Should go back to input with error message.
fields.summary: No length checking when creating a user

fields.description:
It seems as if the workflow name gets inserted into OS_WFENTRY.

Problem is the size of the workflowname field in JIRAWORKFLOWS is 255
but the size of the NAME field in OS_WFENTRY is only 60....

And obviously we had a user that decided to use a really long name :-)

I plan to make a fix - make OS_WFENTRY.NAME varchar(255) - is ok?

fields.description:
Depending on the database, csv importer can fail to import issue when summary is greater than 256 chars.  mysql simply truncates it, other databases throw errors causing import to fail.

Most probably should simply truncate the string to 256. I am guessing other fields also can fail with this as well.
fields.summary: CSV importer can fail when summary is greater than 256 characters
Screen/workflow improvement: allow custom screens per workflow status

fields.description:
After Jira unexpectedly crashed we are no longer seeing any columns displayed in the issue navigator.  It appears to be finding issues correctly for various filters, however, no issue list is being displayed.  When we attempt to configure an issue navigator the drop-down list of column names is empty.  Unassociating the custom field-layout scheme and re-associating it did not help.  Restoring the defaults for the system field layout scheme did not help.

Attached are our various log files.
fields.summary: Unexpected Crash, Now No Columns visible in Issue Navigator

fields.description: Am trying to write come custom queries to extract issue data on which to do some reporting.  We use components within projects however I cannot for the life of me work out how you link an issue to a component.  The jiraissue table has a component field in it but according to the entitymodel.xml this is no longer used.  The issues on the system are raised against the correct component however I can't work out if there is a linking table that I need to use to link jiraissue to component.  Pls advise.  Thanks.
fields.summary: How to link issues to components in SQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7745].
  {panel}

From Marc Palmer:

I would suggest that JIRA have a configuration option added to limit the
issue types and resolutions of issues included in the Change Log and Release
Notes generated - probably separate lists for each.

This would mean that for commercial (not so open) products you can hide
"internal" issues from change logs instead of having to manually edit them
out, or do a custom jira report and format all the data. Much of the time
the changelog/release notes feature is not very useful for commercial
products as there is often a lot of detailed issues that you don't need the
custmoer to see.
fields.summary: Allow to configure the issue types for change log and release notes generation

fields.description:
From  Neal Applebaum:

I think it would be helpful if Atlassian could publish some guide to customizing the Excel output, along the lines of what you put above. For example, for every Excel output I have to:
1) remove the logo
2) remove the opening lines (1-6)
3) remove the closing Generated by summary
4) Change all cells to vertical alignment - top
5) Change all cells to autofit row
6) Change page setup for paper size, margins, custom footer
etc.

Not everyone will want the same defaults, I understand, but it would help if I could customize my own installation the way our site wants it. Now, I've figured out how to accomplish items 1-3 by simply removing some code from navigator-excel-current.jsp (lines 50-69, 105). If I could somehow have the other preferences automatically be the default in the Excel file, that would be great. I think there are many users who rely on printed or electronic spreadsheets for status meetings.
fields.summary: Publish a how-to on customising Excel output

fields.summary: priorityStats exceptions, caused by issues with undefined priority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7739].
  {panel}

Currently it is possible to set up permissions so users can "Edit Watchers".

We would like to allow people to ADD watchers, but only allow leaders of projects to remove watchers.
(Of course you should be able to remove yourself from the watch-list of a bug also).

Typically, somebody who is assigned a bug needs input from other people.
The easiest way would be to add these people to the watcher list, and get their input.
When they have given the input, they can take themselves off the watchers again.
fields.summary: "Add Watchers" permission - but NOT "Remove Watchers"

fields.description:
I have a custom field named "Targeted Release", of type 'version'.
The notification email generated by JIRA says :

Targeted Release: 10301

for my release "3.x.x", description "3.X.X". This appears to be the key of the version.
fields.summary: Custom version fields are not formatted properly in notification email

fields.description:
I have read a bunch of other issues on improvements for cloning - however, independant of all those suggestions, the ui-flow should be such that you go to the edit issue details screen (with all of the cloned data in it) before the issue is saved...

In many cases when you are cloning, a large percentage of the issue may stay the same (hence the reason to clone) but there is usually more than just the subject that you want to edit before you save.
Currently, the only thing to do is to save - and then immediately edit - but unfortunately, the issue-creation email will have already been sent - and it wont be correct.
fields.summary: Cloning an issue should have an extra step - it should take you to the edit issue screen before saving the cloned issue.....

fields.description:
I've had som users complaining about, that sometimes they don't receive mails som JIRA, when they should (eg. when an issue is updated). It doesn't happen often, but periodically.

My Notification Scheme is correct. My e-mail queue is empty, and the error queue is empty too. There is no errors regarding mails in the JIRA log.

Since the e-mail and error queue in JIRA is empty, the problem can be both JIRA and the SMTP server. Since i use my network providers SMTP server (Scandinavias largest provider, so i'm pretty sure, they know how to set up a SMTP server), i'm pretty sure that it is a JIRA problem.

Is there a e-mail log somewhere in JIRA where i can see the mails that JIRA has sent? And the ones that has succeeded / failed?

I've expericences the same problem with jira.atlassian.com. I don't always get notified by mail when you update an issue.
fields.summary: Not all mails gets send

fields.description:
On triggering the Re-open , I got the following error message.

Re-open  
 
Form Errors:
Unable to execute post workflow function. Issue may be in an inconsistent state. Please inform your system administrators immediately. Validation of the field 'resolution' failed: [] {resolution=The resolution selected is invalid.}
fields.summary: Re-Open Issue

fields.description:
exception throw is :

Errors

    * Exception removing issue: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.issue.IssueDelete@1c82121, result: null
fields.summary: Deleting issue with "screenshot" (image) attachement throw exception

fields.description:
We have 4 fields called : Business Area , all single selects with different values, each used by a different project.
When adding a project statistics portlet, you get a dropdown with all 4 (Business Area ,Business Area ,Business Area ,Business Area ) .
The user has no way of choosing the right one .
fields.summary: When adding a project stats portlet, you can see the list of _all_  custom fields, not just the ones for this project.

fields.description:
Requesting feature where passwords can be hashed for placement in a URL string.  Currently the system requires the full username and password to be placed in the URL string but since we are using LDAP authentication, we don't want passwords stored in plaintext anywhere on the users' machines or on our webservers.  We need a better solution than this.  Creating a hash to disguise the password, or both the username and password, would be a great way to identify RSS feeds without this risk.

--Harvey
fields.summary: Add support for basic authentication for RSS feeds

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7731].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Some tasks are allways the same, thej have same summary and description, components...like tasks for deploy. Now I solve this with tasks thet are never closed and when I need souch task I clone IT. This works fine, except that there are allways some open tasks. 

It wold be nice to have something like templates in confluence, where you can define template page..
fields.summary: Template issue

fields.description:
When create a new project ,input  project key as "ABCDEF","abcdef",   "001" , always display "You must specify a unique project key, at least 2 characters long, containing only uppercase letters. "

My jira is new download and installed, database is empty.
fields.summary: Can not create a new project with :You must specify a unique project key, at least 2 characters long, containing only uppercase letters.

fields.description:
In some Java locales, the date picker sets the date to a format which JIRA cannot parse, returning the error:

  You did not enter a valid date. Please enter the date in the format "d-MMM-yy".

This happens for the following languages:

ko (adds date in '23-8-2005' format)
big5 (enters in format 17-八月-2005)

the following languages work:

jp (uses English date format)
zh
tr
ru
sv
(etc - haven't tested them all)
fields.summary: Calendar date picker uses wrong format in some locales
Filter incomming e-mails

fields.description:
A few customers are complaing about NPEs with linked lists in the Issue cache.
In 3.3 this should of been turned off by default in upgrade task.
fields.summary: Upgrade task for turning off issue cache is not working

fields.description:
"No Priority" links from the dashboard doesn't work

It appends a priority=-1 which isn't understood by the current searcher. This shouldn't affect too many installations since Priority is usually not blank. However, will cause people some confusion on when using the stats portlet.
fields.summary: "No Priority" links from the dashboard doesn't work

fields.description:
When I create an issue and then sub task associated with that issue there is no way for me to view the 'total' time fields for that particular issue. 

For example, if I create an issue with two sub-tasks both estimated to take 2 hrs each then when I view the issue there is no way for me to see that the issue is estimated to take 4hrs total (other total fields that would be good are 'remaining time' and 'time spent'.
fields.summary: Total estimated time to include subtasks
Would like to send comment email to multiple issues at the same time

fields.description:
If the generated backfile is opened and saved with an editor that inserts the unicode marker <FEFF>  at the begining of the file, the Restore Data fails.  I assume this is the same for where ever  we use xerces to pass an xml file.

Dylan fixed this for the entityengine.xml file by using dom4j.

Easy work around is to remove the marker.
fields.summary: Unicode marker causes data restore to fail
Non-System Custom Link Types [source patch provided]
Allow to register Bulk Operations as plugins [source patch provided]

fields.description:
At the moment when the filter is modified the message 'Filter modified since loading' is displayed when the remote user is the owner of the filter. If not, the 'red dot' appears when the filter is modified by the message does not, which is inconsistent.

Also need to ensure that when clicking a participant in the results of a issue partcipants custom field, JIRA detects filter modification and displays the message.
fields.summary: Message 'Filter modified since loading' is only displayed when the user is the owner of the filter

fields.description:
The Screenlayout  of the issue navigator is totally screwed by our long project names. The left column gets so wide, that it hangs into the area, where the issues are displayed.

This is only a problem with FireFox. Its all fine with IE6
fields.summary: Navigator screwed by long project names in FireFox - no problem with IE

fields.description:
as best as I can surmise what happened here:
- I was on the "subversion commits" tab of a project
- I went to an issue in a different project that didn't have that tab
- none of the tabs in that aread was selected, so I just had the empty box.

It looked like there was no comments however - confusing. I had to click the comments field to get them back.

If the version control tab is not there, it should select the default tab.
fields.summary: confusing result of switching to a project without version control tab

fields.description: Would you guys be willing to install the wonderful Toolkit Mark published on jira.atlassian.com? It has the ability to create a custom field to show and filter by participants of an issue. I would find it very useful to find issues I have commented on, and I just figured this was not available, but now I see it can be.
fields.summary: Install show participants custom field on jira.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7716].
  {panel}

this in itself is not such a bad thing as you shouldn't change the original estimate, but the problem is more that you are allowed to log work when there was no original estimate, and there is no way to go back and fix such a mistake. It would be good to be able to either:
a) delete the work log and get back to sqaure one (I'm already watching that issue separately)
b) be able to edit the original estimate independently of the remaining estimate
c) ban logging work without an estimate
fields.summary: impossible to correct original estimate if work has been logged.

fields.description: The possibility to register hours on a issue for the employees that are assigned to the issue.
fields.summary: hour registration

fields.description: In JIRA, if the locale in Admin -> General Configuration is set to None, JIRA uses the system locale.  When JIRA does not have a translation for the system locale (af, al, ca, du, fi, hr, hu, ko, lt, lv, nl, ro, si, sk, sl, sp, sr, sv, tr), JIRA defaults to English.  This is not very useful, because English dates will not validate in the default date format.
fields.summary: Calendar picker uses wrong date format (English) for untranslated locales

fields.description:
The following calendars appear blank in JIRA:

calendar-af.js
calendar-du.js
calendar-hr.js
calendar-hr-utf8.js
calendar-ja.js
calendar-jp.js
calendar-sr.js
calendar-tr.js

This appears to be because they lack a definition for the Calendar._SDN (short day name) array.
fields.summary: Blank calendar for certain languages
Show the version description and dates in the tooltip for version select box

fields.description:
Say a \{noformat} macro in a comment has a long line:

{noformat}
womblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomble
{noformat}

This causes the whole page to widen, requiring a horizontal scrollbar, and content (particularly fields at the top) gets pushed off to the right of the screen.

The \{noformat} tag should (like in Confluence) be given its own horizontal scrollbar to scoll long text.

UPDATE : 

In a similar vein, long lines of "unbroken" text inside a text area field will also cause the wide  scrolling to appear
for example like this :


womblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomblewomble

JRA-13700 reports this use case for example.
fields.summary: Allow code and noformat sections, and long text in general, in Wiki or Plain textfields  to scroll horizontally

fields.description:
At the momnet if an custom issue tab panel returns an object that returns null for getTimePerformed(), the All tab will die as the compareTo method does not cater for null timestamps.

Need to ensure that the compareTo method does not die with null timestamps and logs a warning instead.
fields.summary: Allow Issue Actions to return null

fields.description:
Must be picking up an older/newer XML library from somewhere in Webfear....

We tried switching the classloader to parent-last - but it wouldnt deploy. Didnt have time to investigate why it failed to deploy.

FYI you do seem to have at least 2 jars with the xml api classes in the lib dir...  that needs fixing.

Let us know how you get on with the version of webfear you are running....

-Nick
